meanings.definition: The act of closing down a business or operation.
meanings.sent1: The closedowns of small shops during the pandemic have been devastating for many owners.
meanings.sent2: The government ordered the closedowns of all non-essential services to curb the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The closedowns of the ice cream parlors left the town feeling a bit too quiet.
meanings.sent4: The closedowns of factories echoed through the empty streets like a silent drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The closedowns of the local stores painted a bleak picture of the economic situation.

meanings.definition: The process of shutting down or ceasing operations.
meanings.sent1: The closedowns of the factories were gradual, giving workers time to find new jobs.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the closedowns of flights caused chaos at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The closedowns of the amusement park rides made the children pout in disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The closedowns of the old coal mines marked the end of an era for the town.
meanings.sent5: The closedowns of the computer systems led to a complete halt in production.

meanings.definition: The state of being closed or shut down.
meanings.sent1: The closedowns of the schools meant students had to switch to online learning.
meanings.sent2: The closedowns of the roads due to snow made commuting impossible.
meanings.sent3: The closedowns of the theme park attractions left visitors feeling stranded.
meanings.sent4: The closedowns of the shops on Sundays gave the town a peaceful vibe.
meanings.sent5: The closedowns of the train stations caused confusion among travelers.
